title: Columnist Nicholas Kristof Departs New York Times to Pursue Oregon Governor’s Seat
sub_head: The 37-year Times veteran has been considering a run for governor of Oregon, whose current Democratic leader faces term limits
body:
Longtime New York Times opinion columnist Nick Kristof is leaving the organization ahead of a potential run for governor in his home state of Oregon, the newspaper’s opinion editor said.
Mr. Kristof had been on leave from the news outlet since June as he explored running for office, opinion editor Kathleen Kingsbury said in a note to colleagues Thursday. The news outlet’s policy states that staff may not seek public office anywhere.
